domain.name: NV_MMIO

bitset.name: g80_gpio
bitset.bitfield: if set, OUT or DISPLAY/NVIO control OUT will be flipped

bitset.name: g80_pnvio_i2c_bitbang
bitset.bitfield: selects who controls the CL/DA output, input works regardless

domain.bitset: write something non-0 here to start a transaction, this field is write-only

reg32.name: NV_RAMUSERD
reg32.bitfield:
XXX: check these
XXX: there are more XXX: there are more RO bits here

array.name: PGPIO
array.reg32: write 1 to make OUT, OE, OUT_NEG changes happen
0/7f/0 XXX: this is also used for something with NORMAL

reg32.name: GPIO
reg32.bitfield: if set, OUT or DISPLAY/NVIO control OUT will be flipped

reg32.name: SPECIAL_IN
reg32.bitfield: peek at the GPIO value before negation, only works on some INs: 0-3, 8-0xa, 0x10-0x11, 0x14-0x16

array.name: PNVIO
array.reg32: 0/7f/0 XXX: three unk bits on G84:G94 at 15-17

reg32.name: DUTY
reg32.doc: e120's scan is 03ffffff compared to e118's that is 00ffffff Bit 01000000 seems to require both the bit 31 trigger *and* writing to duty again to make the write count.

array.array: XXX: figure out how much of this applies to cards other than g80

reg32.name: CLOCK_SOURCE
reg32.doc: XTPLL is always linked to SOURCE_PLL2

reg32.name: IBUF_ENABLE_0
reg32.doc: Enables input buffers for given pins. Output functionality is unaffected.
reg32.bitfield: you have to poke 1 to this bit to force non-default value

array.reg32: most likely a hw bug... the bitfield is different for writes and reads

like e100, but for GPIOs 16-31.
if a given bit is 0, NVIO spec output for a given line outputs 0 for 0, 1 for 1; if a given bit is 1, it outputs 0 for 0 and Hi-Z for 1 instead.

reg32.name: COUNT
reg32.bitfield: ie. the one in progress now

reg32.name: CTRL
reg32.doc: If both ENABLE and PWROFF are set
